Title: Software Engineering – Guide to the Software Engineering Body of Knowledge (SWEBOK)
Description: Identifies and describes the subset of body of knowledge of software engineering that is generally accepted

Title: Systems and software engineering – System life cycle processes
Description: Establishes a common framework for describing the life cycle of systems created by humans and defines a set of processes and associated terminology

Title: Systems and software engineering – Software life cycle processes
Description: Establishes a common framework for software life cycle processes with well-defined terminology

Title: Information technology – Service management – Part 1: Service management system requirements
Description: Specifies requirements for the service provider to plan, establish, implement, operate, monitor, review, maintain, and improve a service management system (SMS)

Title: Information technology – Process assessment – Part 1: Concepts and vocabulary
Description: Provides overall information on the concepts of process assessment and its use in the two contexts of process improvement and process capability determination

Title: Systems and software engineering – Architecture description
Description: Addresses the creation, analysis, and sustainment of architectures of systems through the use of architecture descriptions

Title: Software engineering – Lifecycle profiles for Very Small Entities (VSEs) – Part 1: Overview
Description: Introduces the characteristics and requirements of a VSE and clarifies the rationale for VSE-specific profiles, documents, standards, and guides

Title: Software engineering – Product quality – Part 2: External metrics
Description: Provides external metrics for measuring attributes of six external quality characteristics defined in ISO/IEC 9126-1
